{{infobox road |country=IRN |type=expressway |name= Resalat Expressway |translation = Ø¨Ø²Ø±Ú¯Ø±Ø§Ù Ø±Ø³Ø§ÙØª |direction_a=East |terminus_a = [[File:Zeichen 123.svg|30px]][[File:AB-Kreuz-grÃ¼n.svg|25px]][[File:Expressway in Iran.png|30px]] [[Yasini Expressway]] |junction |direction_b=West |terminus_b = [[File:AB-Kreuz-grÃ¼n.svg|25px]][[File:Expressway in Iran.png|30px]] [[Hakim Expressway]]
[[File:Expressway in Iran.png|30px]] [[Kordestan Expressway]] |length_km= 12 |cities = [[Tehran]] |map = Resalat Expressway map.png }} '''Resalat Expressway''' is an east-west [[Limited-access road|expressway]] in [[Tehran]], [[Iran]]. It joins the eastern localities of [[Tehran metropolis]], including [[Resalat District]], to [[Seyed Khandan]] in north-central Tehran and further to western parts of the [[Greater Tehran]]. The Resalat Tunnel was opened by [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]] with newlyweds being the first to drive through it. Upon praying in the tunnel at its re-opening, [[Rageh Omaar]] of the BBC prayed on the same prayer mat as Ahmadinejad at the same time.
